text:
Air pollution, energy insecurity, and global 
warming - fixing these huge problems may seem

impossible. But we don't need a miracle. We 
can save our Earth and clean our air and we can

start right now using the technology we already 
have. I'm Mark Jacobson, a Professor of civil and

environmental engineering at Stanford University. 
In this course I'll take you inside my classroom

and share the science and strategies for building 
clean renewable energy and storage for everything.

From our transportation system and electricity 
infrastructure, to our industries and businesses

you will learn about the key technologies for 
harnessing the power of the wind, the water,

and the sun with storage to meet all our energy 
needs. You will also learn how to make power grids

efficient, resilient, and dependable anywhere in 
the world, and how to develop and Implement a road

map to transition your country, state, community, 
or business to 100 clean renewable energy.

You don't have to be a scientist or an engineer. 
These lessons are for anyone who wants to

understand the latest research about what works 
what doesn't and why. We'll explain everything

from photovoltaics, to hydroelectricity, to wind 
turbines, to batteries, to electrolyzers, to heat

pumps, and show you why renewable electricity 
generation and storage won't just save our planet

it'll also create new job opportunities from 
energy to manufacturing. Whether you work in

business, government, education, or the nonprofit 
sector this foundational course will give you the

practical knowledge you need to communicate 
about those important issues with confidence,

transform your organization, and 
contribute to a healthier planet.
